channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Vibe Shows Info About Any Email Contact Across the Browser
item.description:
Chrome: Got a mail from someone you don't know? One easy way to look up information about them is to get Vibe and just hover your cursor over the email address.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Four Body Language Cues That Might Indicate Someone’s Lying
item.description:
You can never prove someone is lying just by looking at non-verbal cues—but they can let you know when something might be off. David DeSteno, a professor of psychology at Northeastern University, conducted a thorough study and found four non-verbal indicators you might want to look for.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Check Out the Best From This Week's Open Thread
item.description:
• The Open Thread Recipe Sharing Club has a few vegetarian delights this week.
  • Any recommendations for a $30 or less AC USB charger with 2 ports that can both output 2.1A simultaneously. Need to charge a Nook HD and Android phone at the same time.
  • What do you think about the new look of the Kinja 1.2 update?
  • Any thoughts on what I can do with leftover tandoori chicken?
  • I love it when people have themed names for hard drives and computers. What are yours? Any suggestions for me?
  • Got my new Macbook, converting from Windows for the first time. Any tips for a Mac newbie?
  • Has anyone got a favorite site or primer that teaches web writing for general public? I need to simplify the content academics are giving me.
  • I'm 34 and going out for a date with a girl who is 10 years younger. Given the age gap, any pointers on what we could talk about?
  • Does anyone have any cheat sheets for proper editing guidelines for Websites?
  • I have a major dust problem at my work desk. How do you combat dusty desks?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Capture the "Triangle" with Your Webcam to Look Better on Video Calls
item.description:
It's not easy to always look good on video calls, but correct framing is the first step, suggests Paul J. Bailo, author of The Essential Digital Interview Handbook, whose previous advice includes not neglecting your body language for video interviews.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Chorus Beams Music to Multiple Android Devices at Once
item.description:
Android: Several of Samsung's Android phones come with a cool feature called "Group Play" which lets you connect several phones to play the same song on all of them at the same time. Well, if you aren't using a Samsung gadget, you can now do that with Chorus.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Remember Names and Details with this 15-Minute Nightly Exercise
item.description:
The ability to remember people's names serves you well in networking, but not all of us are adept at it. You can use small tricks like trying to figure out their eye color or getting it right the first time but those depend on you making the connection in your introduction. Instead, a brief revision at the end of the day might be a better strategy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Five Best Mobile Hotspots
item.description:
Getting access to high-speed internet on the go doesn't have to mean using someone's wide-open Wi-Fi. There are plenty of great 3G and 4G hotspots that get the job done, don't cost an arm and a leg, and are small enough to keep in your pocket for when you need them. Whether you're on the road or cable's out at home, here are five of the best mobile hotspots to keep you connected.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Searchonymous Searches Google Anonymously While Signed In
item.description:
Firefox: A lot of people are scared of Google's privacy policy and the way it tracks everything you do on the web, especially your web searches. DuckDuckGo is a great option for track-free searches, but if you still want to use Google without giving over all your data, Searchonymous is the easiest way to make it happen.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: This Week's Top Downloads
item.description:
Every week, we share a number of downloads for all platforms to help you get things done. Here were the top downloads from this week.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Target Utility or Curiosity for More Enticing Email Subject Lines
item.description:
It's best to write an email's subject line after you're done with the body, and try to make it actionable. But if you want to make sure your email is being clicked, offer either utility or curiosity in the subject, suggests a study by researchers at Carnegie Mellon University.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Ziner is a Gorgeous Free News Reader that Syncs with Feedly
item.description:
iOS: Our favorite news reader for the iPhone is still Reeder, but there have been some other strong contenders lately. Unread is a solid option, and personally, I've fallen in love with Ziner because it combines many of Reeder's best features for the grand price of free.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Kickstarter Hacked, Change Your Passwords Now
item.description:
If you're a Kickstarter user, it's time to change your account's password. The crowd-funding platform has had a security breach and recommends changing your password on the site, as well as at any other websites where you used the same password.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: GIFwrapped Saves GIFs from Twitter, Photos and Searches for Later
item.description:
iOS: If you like to annotate your tweets and messages with animated GIFs, we have a guide to make some of your own. But for those you didn't create, GIFwrapped is a handy tool to save GIFs in a vault to use them later.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: The Master Sleeve Roll Keeps Shirt Sleeves from Unfolding
item.description:
If the simple sleeve roll doesn't work for you, the Master Sleeve Roll (demonstrated here by Antonio Centeno of Real Men Real Style) will fix this problem by staying firm and looking good doing it. Plus, it's easier to unfold/unroll too.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: NoRoot Firewall Controls Internet Access for Apps
item.description:
Android: Most of the apps on your Android device probably require a data connection, and you may not even know when they are sending or receiving data. NoRoot Firewall puts you in control of Internet access for apps, as well as how they can access it.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: MakerParent Aggregates Collaborative DIY Projects for Adults and Kids
item.description:
DIY projects are all the rage here at Lifehacker and if you have a young one in whom you want to kindle an interest for such stuff, then MakerParent is a fantastic resource where one parent is collect activities to do with kids.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Top 10 Ways to Repurpose Your Old Laptop
item.description:
There's no shortage of ways to repurpose an old PC, whether you're just trying to make it work again or turning it into something else entirely, like a home server. Laptops, are special though—due to their small size and all-in-one nature, a bit of DIY work can turn a laptop into just about anything. Here are some options.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Whitson Gordon

item.title: Make Health-Related Decisions When You're Exhausted
item.description:
Your mind can be tricked into making healthier choices, such as treating healthy foods like samples. But the best way to make a healthier choice is to push that decision till you're exhausted, says a new study.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: The Valentine's Day Survival Guide
item.description:
Valentine's Day can be a wonderful time to celebrate love; it can also be a hellish disaster waiting to happen. Here's how to hack Valentine's Day to make it a night you'll actually want to remember—whether you've got someone to spend it with or not.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Adam Dachis

item.title: Gloss Is a Simplified Web Clipper for Saving Important Content
item.description:
Evernote's Web Clipper is a fantastic way to save select parts of an article, but it's not really useful unless you use Evernote. If you'd prefer something far simpler, Gloss allows you to highlight and save text from any site quickly.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Have Your Kids Sign an Internet Contract
item.description:
Letting your kids be on the internet can be scary. You can keep an eye on what they're up to and there are ways to help keep them safe, but you might also want to take a page from schools that provide internet access and have them sign an appropriate-use contract.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Walter Glenn

item.title: What Home Health Remedies Do You Swear By?
item.description:
Not every malady deserves a visit to the doctor or pharmacy. Some, like headaches, stomaches, hangovers, or even athlete's foot can be cured with ingredients from your kitchen. So, we want to hear about it: what home remedies do you swear by?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Gawker Man Uses Classifieds to Troll Date With Breaking Bad Valentine's Ad | Jalopnik The Ten Worst
item.description:
Gawker Man Uses Classifieds to Troll Date With Breaking Bad Valentine's Ad | Jalopnik The Ten Worst Cars To Have Sex In | Jezebel This Short Film May Hold the Truth About Why You Are Single | Kotaku Norway Mass Murderer Demands Better Video Games in Prison | Kinja Popular Posts

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Smith on io9, shared by Whitson Gordon to Lifehacker

item.title: How Can I Shut Off Internet Service for My Deadbeat Roommates?
item.description:
Deadbeat roommates? You don't have to tolerate their delinquent checks. Turn the internet off on them—automatically. With a little coding chops you can do it. The experts at Stack Exchange tell you how.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Tessa Miller

item.title: SuperTab Adds Tons of New Options Your Tab Switcher
item.description:
Mac: Command+Tab has long been the easiest way to quickly switch between active applications, but it's limited in functionality. If you'd like some more options, SuperTab adds all kinds of customizable tools to your tab switcher.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski
